website_summaries.verdict: The Keen Brixen Waterproof Low is packed with plenty of practical features for the cold weather such as the KEEN.DRY for keeping water and elements out and KEEN.WARM to shield feet from the cold during winter. Its slip-on function and simple design were also praised for its convenience and versatility.A sneaker included in Keen’s lifestyle shoe collection, its excellent traction, waterproof construct, and heat retaining feature make it a practical and exceptional choice for colder months.
pros: An overwhelming majority of shoe users were impressed at how comfortable the Keen Brixen Waterproof Low is
A few commenters with feet condition added that it helped alleviate their symptoms
Most wearers appreciate this pair’s heat insulation as it keeps feet warm and toasty in the winter
Plenty of reviewers attest to this shoe’s long-lasting wear and durability
Some said that it looks dressy enough for work
A great number of consumers commended this sneaker’s efficient waterproof feature
The Keen Brixen Waterproof Low is true to size
This shoe’s slip-on function provides ease and convenience, according to a number of reviewers’ opinions
It has excellent traction ideal for icy surfaces during winter
cons: A good number of reviewers said that the shoe’s opening felt a little too tight at first and caused discomfort around the ankle but added that it adjusts perfectly after the break-in period

customer_reviews.title: Once you've gone KEEN  that's it - You're hooked!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned and worn Keen's now for 25 years - (everyday almost). And that 25 years of wearing them was with one pair that now could use a vacation. This show fits perfectly as did my first pair. Plus the added insulation was a comfortable add-on. I had taken out the original inserts over time on the first pair and added my own professional orthopedic inserts, but these, so far, are working out perfectly - as is. Simple and timeless in style.
customer_reviews.author: Handy Dandy.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite fall/winter shoe.
customer_reviews.text: These are my all time favorite fall, winter shoe. Not the best looking. But they have great soles that provide really good footing, don't leave black marks. Waterproof, lined and warm. The backside of the shoe-heel has ribs so you can use your other foot to remove them. These are really tough and well made. These are great. This is my third pair. I have them in both balck and brown. This is a pair I bought to leave in the box until my current black pair wears out. Just the best shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Vintagemac

customer_reviews.title: Make sure they’re comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a second pair that I’m wearing. I had to return my first pair because the rim of the left shoe was cutting into my ankle with every step. It was cutting into my ankle so much I began to limp and even had to hop around to avoid the pain. My second pair feels much more comfortable, I do notice the snug fit around both my ankles but they’re not cutting into me like the first pair. They’re warm and water resistant, which in the Midwest is a must. Wearing warm socks with these shoes will definitely keep you toasty. I really enjoy slipping into these especially if you’re wearing heavy winter coats. I’m really enjoying these KEENS.
customer_reviews.author: Junior C.

customer_reviews.title: As expected, perfect KEEN
customer_reviews.text: I have diabetes and it makes my toes more sensitive. I hate getting old but am thankful for my Keens. The toe protection is perfect. It really feels like a breath of fresh air and relief. They really are size standard so I can buy an 11 in a number of keen styles. I also hate falling because of slipping on a wet floor. These are perfect at stopping me from hitting the floor due to wet skipping etc... Finally, this is the first shoes I have had that don't tie. I threw an extra memory foam sole in and these are fitted perfectly. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brian T. Clem

customer_reviews.title: Needed to Find a New Style of Go-To Keens
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Keen's Boston shoes for years, the past few years they have been hard to find but I usually find them, this year my last pair was so worn I couldn't wear them to work anymore and I after a few months of searching I knew it was time to find a new work shoe so I used the Amazon marketplace to order 4 different pairs and Brixen is the style I kept. They are slip on which I didn't think I'd like but they are comfortable, I am on my feet most of the day and they wore in easily and I like the brown color. They fit like a keen with a wide protected toe box.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisB

customer_reviews.title: Wide and priced funny.
customer_reviews.text: Built solid like a Keen product- would probably last me several Pennsylvania winters, just too wide. I wear size ten as a rule but should have tried going down a half size. By the time I set up return for these and decided to try 9.5 the price was almost $40 more. That doesn't make sense. I mean at a shoe store I would have given the 10 back and gotten the 9.5 and headed home. Well anyhow they did feel warm and the sole has material to keep that area from getting cold. Probably a great shoe- but $40 difference between a 9.5 and a 10?
customer_reviews.author: BikeMike

customer_reviews.title: Beware - these are a pretty wide fitting shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty disappointed in these. I've never had problem fitting shoes, but after following Keen's advice to order 1/2 a size up from norm (which proved to be too large), I ordered these in my expected size, and they still didn't fit right. They were the right length, but the width was too broad in the back. Almost felt like they should have been labeled Wide. This is more of a personal fit issue than a recrimination of the shoe's design or build quality, which seemed to be pretty solid. I was not able to find these shoes in a local shop due to limited inventory (online too), which led to 2 returned pair online, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: skojo

customer_reviews.title: I love Keen shoes and boots, but they are a little irregular in their sizing
customer_reviews.text: It was just slightly loose upon arrival, but over time it became increasingly loose, like I can get my whole finger in at the back of the shoe. They are ok for convenience, but uncomfortable for day long wear. Also I did not notice the "insulated" part in the title and these shoes are downright hot for low-top slip-ons.
customer_reviews.author: Ethosian

customer_reviews.title: To wide in the heel..
customer_reviews.text: I read previous reviews and they said order 1/2 size smaller so I did.... the length was not the problem...the width in the heel is HUGE... I can understand making the shoe so the wearer can slip on the shoe but my heel comes up a whole lot and moves side to side also....I just don't know what they were thinking...I'll use it for just around the outside near the house but I sure wouldn't wear it an a mile walk ...I wish Amazon would be little better at providing EASY returns ...it's just not worth all the hassle ....
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: They hurt
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like them and paid around $250 CAD after 2 day shipping. Unfortunately, the tongue is too short and has a hard roll at the end of it. Sits just in the right spot to dig into the front of my ankle and hurt with each step which renders them pretty much useless and unwearable. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: C Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and long lasting!
customer_reviews.text: I own two pairs of these shoes. The first pair I purchased at a local shoe store. The first pair was about 1/2 smaller than I normally wear in other brands. I have wide feet and these felt so good I ordered a second pair in the darker color. I've worn these nearly everyday for about a year and a half. Very comfortable. Initially I was leery about spending this much on a pair of shoes. They never leak and I still have lots of wear left on the soles. I came on Amazon today to see if these are still available. Thinking about purchasing a new pair of the brown ones for dressier occasions. Love em!
customer_reviews.author: GASLOAN

customer_reviews.title: these run small.
customer_reviews.text: After two hours searching for the best slip on low top rugged shoe, I ordered these. The shoe was too small. The tongue was a bit pokey on my upper foot.... Possibly because it was too small. It was most certainly wide enough, and I have a pretty wide foot. I may order the next size up, but I did end up sending them back. Can’t really give them a full review because I didn’t wear them more than 20 minutes trying to see if I was going to send them back or not.
customer_reviews.author: Rob in Alaska

customer_reviews.title: Too Narrow
customer_reviews.text: The prior model of these Keen shoes fit great (size 10) but this model is much narrower. I tried stretching them which helped but not enough. They are quite nice looking so it's too bad the design doesn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: MikeSz

customer_reviews.title: Works for what I have to use them for
customer_reviews.text: I bought only these because I have to wear a leg brace that goes under the insert and up my calf and need more toe box room and I did like that there supposed to keep feet warm however I feel that only 200grams of there insulation isn’t enough my good foot isn’t staying warm my bad leg is always cold even in summer I have found another brand that keeps my foot warm in winter but won’t fit the brace so I have no other choices except the medical shoes that suck so I’m going to try another keen style and see
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THIS SHOE SAVE MY LEGS
customer_reviews.text: MY BAD WAS NOT RESPECTING KEEN'S FIT ACCURACY, SO I BOUGHT A HALF SIZE TOO LARGE. BUT WHEN I FIRST WORE THEM, THEY SAVED MY FEET, LEGS, AND KNEES, WHEN I HAD TO REMOVE MY LARGE DOG FROM A STREAM, AFTER 7 TRIES, IN A FIST FIGHT WITH THE MOST FERILE ALBINO CAT EVER. THIS CAT WOULD NOT BACK DOWN. MY DOG'S FACE LOOKED LIKE A PUGILIST AFTER A FIGHT WITH CASSIUS CLAY ALI !!! SO I DID NOT RETURN THEM BUT DONATED THEM TO A NEEDY PERSON WITH THE RIGHT SIZE FEET.
customer_reviews.author: Angel L. Franqui

customer_reviews.title: falling apart
customer_reviews.text: These are super comfortable, I use them for biking in cold weather and everyday wear. They are already starting to separate at the soles behind the toe box (both shoes). I ordered these February 1st 2019, about 10 weeks of wear, for 100 dollar shoes this is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Great knockaround shoe
customer_reviews.text: My last pair of Keens lasted far longer than I could ever have expected. This pair is already wearing so well that I have to wholeheartedly endorse them for as rugged a service as anyone would wish. It did take some time to stretch once I began to wear them as noted above. Though not an instant fit that later too large or sloppy endurance of the product is the key to my applause.
customer_reviews.author: d'rch FROG

customer_reviews.title: break in period they fit great, feel great
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these 1/2 size larger than I normally wear because I planned on wearing them exclusively in my garage wood work shop in the (NJ) winter. I wanted to be able to wear thick merino wool socks and just slip the shoes on and off. After a short, 1 day, break in period they fit great, feel great, and keep my feet warm. Now I find I am often wearing them outside the shop to run errands around town - may have to get another pair that fits!
customer_reviews.author: Marc S

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made!
customer_reviews.text: I dislike how poorly manufactured this shoe is! This is the worst pair of Keen shoes/boots I have ever owned. You will see in the picture I posted, the seam on the outside of the front has broken thru! I don't even wear these shoes very often. I would like them replaced. I will let you know how things go with the seller!
customer_reviews.author: Lance Kenyon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fit, no break in needed good to go right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: For me very comfortable for my 3E wide foot. I’m in the woods, around cattle, hunting, plenty of standing and walking and at the end of the day these Brixen’s are the most comfortable shoe I’ve ever had. I was apprehensive at first because I only where cowboy boots and kangaroo tie up boots. I’m in expectation of continued comfort with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: "Tex"

customer_reviews.title: Sharp looking, warm and comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: I really like these shoes. Easy to slide on and off, warm and waterproof. Only negative is that they’re slightly loose fitting with little arch support. I’m considering using an insert to bump up comfort, but either way they are my go to shoes this cold and wet fall.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The shoes were comfortable right out of the box and are true to size. The innersole is removable. I had to add ortho arch supports to address foot issues (very high arch and bunions). The toe box is large enough to accommodate the supports quite well. My only complaint is that the innersoles that they were supplied with could have been more substantial with a higher arch and padding.
customer_reviews.author: Mic R

customer_reviews.title: Inserts are junk!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased so many pairs of Keen shoes for everyone in my family and these are the worst inserts out of any Keens! I had to order new inserts because the ones that come with these shoes are so uncomfortable. They are a thermal/fleece material that I have never had in Keens before. The inserts are so thick that they make the shoes too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Jeffers

customer_reviews.title: The sole is comfortable, although I did add gel/foam replacements
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes because I work on an environment where I am standing most of the time but I need protection from sharps and fluids. The sole is comfortable, although I did add gel/foam replacements. The only problem, is that they are too tight at the forefoot, just at the ankle. So bad that they hurt at first. I think they are loosening (or my feet are going numb) but I am hoping that by the end of the month they are going to be very comfortable (once they break) and I will love them as I do other Keen shoes.
customer_reviews.author: ddb

customer_reviews.title: These shoes fit about like the boondockers I got in the Navy
customer_reviews.text: They are heavy. They will probably still be around when I am dead. Tough is an understatement about the construction of these shoes. I doubt that I will ever be able to wear these shoes out. I think the break-in time for these shoes is going to me months rather than days or weeks even if I wear them every day and I probably will.
customer_reviews.author: D. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are a tank...
customer_reviews.text: I needed slip-on shoes for daily work... these are a beast, they take a pounding and don't seem worn out or disfigured, etc. very practical to use while travelling on planes (going through security) easy on/easy off, waterproof, comfortable, what else you want? KEEN is my favorite brand and would definitely buy again and recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Chen

customer_reviews.title: Superior Product
customer_reviews.text: This is the best pair of shoes I have ever owned. Living in the northwoods of Minnesota I wanted something warm, with good thread that I could slip on easily during the Fall and Winter months. I couldn't be more pleased with my purchase. This is a solid shoe that looks great and last longer then expected. I tend to wear out shoes quickly, not caring for them as I should but I purchased my first pair of laced KEEN shoes a couple of years ago and I still wear them today.
customer_reviews.author: dtap

customer_reviews.title: Love KEEN
customer_reviews.text: Love these things! There warm ,dry, easy on and off can't say enough good! Can't think of anything negative!! I bought a pair of Austen's a couple years ago now I own 5 pairs. Sandls ,loafers,work boots there all good. Some have been a little snug but they brake in really quick ! Read reviews on fit!!
customer_reviews.author: M J M

customer_reviews.title: they are perfectly comfortable. I particularly like the thick sole
customer_reviews.text: These are a little wider than other Keens I have purchased but not to the extent that I'm unable to wear them. Obviously, that waterproof and snow proof thing is going to have to wait a few months as it is only September in Maine. I don't expect snow in the next 60 days. Other than that, they are perfectly comfortable. I particularly like the thick sole. I don't want to be able to tell heads from tails on a coin I step on. I'm not into the "minimalist" shoe concept - hurts my feet. If I find that these shoes end up feeling a little big, I'll add an insert. No big deal. I like them.
customer_reviews.author: CDRLARSON

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome!! My husband is a restaurant general manager, so he runs around on his feet all day (sometimes 14hrs), on slippery/wet/greasy surfaces, and even shovels snow off the front walkway - so he needs a comfortable, supportive shoe that can take the abuse while still looking professional. He loves these shoes! They fit perfectly, even on his wide foot, have good traction on slippery floors and ice, are warm in the snow, and stay comfortable on those long, hard-working days. Definitely the best work shoe he's found - we'll be buying another pair when he finally runs the tread off these.
customer_reviews.author: Adrianne

customer_reviews.title: They have a break in period, after which they are excellent.
customer_reviews.text: My husband had the same problem with these as some of the other commentors. They were tight across the top edge. He pushed through it, however, and continued to wear them until they broke in, and now they are his favorite shoes. The wool felt lining has molded to his foot, and made them a perfect fit. He wears them every day in cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: janedough

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves these. Used to get romeos but ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these. Used to get romeos but have changed to keen. Bought for my father in law too. Update: I am always looking for these to go on 'sale'. My husband goes through these every 4-6 months, but he is really hard on them and only wears them when he isn't working at the firehouse!! He can't say enough about them!!
customer_reviews.author: MamaTaylor

customer_reviews.title: Listen up.
customer_reviews.text: Fits great. I bought 1/2 size larger than the normal size I wear and again they fit excellent. This is my second pair of low tops and on my second pair of perfect fitting boots. Consider 1/2 larger than your normal size and know with confidence they are going to fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Roger F.

customer_reviews.title: Wears out to fast and poor footing
customer_reviews.text: I have had same shoe for couple of years and each time I have to replace them is because they wear out at the seams. And my feet get wet because there are holes in the shoes now. Very frustrating. Plus the soles are very slippery on even just wet surfaces. let alone snow and ice. The concept is perfect for what I need. Slip on. Black and the toe guard is good for my service type job working often while kneeling. But for the price would need 4 of them minimum to receive a true value at all. But I try not to complain. I ordered another pair in Hope's it will last longer then the other ones.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Schonasky

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are so slippery!  Something with the traction on the bottom of the shoes
customer_reviews.text: The shoes were very good looking. Fit fairly well and were warm. However, the shoes state that they are great for hiking and you could get really hurt since there was no traction at all with these shoes. Skidding and slipping all around the whole time we were walking - the ground was damp but I would expect hiking shoes to have great traction and these had none at all.
customer_reviews.author: B. Boop

customer_reviews.title: Quality shoes that fit
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet and medical issues with my feet. Since I discovered Keen shoes it's been much easier to buy a shoe that fits well, and lasts! I'm a big man and shoes usually don't last long, but Keen shoes last me years! You may pay a higher price, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Slussman

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes have been wearing them for now about 6 years. I wear them everyday. I have a wide foot. The very first time I tried these I was hooked. The only issue I have is that I am a auto mechanic. I work on the floor under cars on a creeper and on my side a lot. With my foot on its side it tends to drag and unfortunately tears the stitching which of course sucks. They do last me about a year. I wish I could get them double stitched so hopefully this will not happen. I just ordered another pair. I may try to find a place that can double the stitching.
customer_reviews.author: Mls85

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great looking shoe but runs smaller than other keen shoes. Will update after bigger size arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Crum

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shoe!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these shoes so much that we ordered two more pairs. They do run a little small so get a half size larger . They have great arch support , soft heals and have helped with his planters fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best!!
customer_reviews.text: My first Keen shoe purchase but definitely won't be my last! These casual shoes surpassed my expectations as they are fantastic in all aspects!! These shoes are superb and I can find no negatives at all. You get what you pay for and I love these fine crafted leather shoes!!
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: you never know what sizeyoul get.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned 6 or 8 of these now. the last couple years you can order a size 13 and they fit like 11.5s. I bought a pair (not from amazon) that were size 12. to small. ordered 13's from amazon and pretty much the same size. my mistake was wearing them out side before I knew I knew how well they fit. I have some 11.5s that are perfect. every thing else is great. what gives? all same shoe.
customer_reviews.author: kevin gates

customer_reviews.title: Best Shoes Ever!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best shoes I've ever owned. I'm quite rough on shoes and these shoes have held up great. I have an old pair that is 6 yrs old, that I still actually use for the dirtiest jobs. So I bought another pair. They are great throughout the year for me. Winter, spring, summer, or fall great warmth, breathabilty and waterproof. I dont use them for running, bike riding, or nicer occasions. Other than that, they're a great shoe. In the pics you can see the old pair 6 yrs old and the new pair lol.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Zychowski

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are very wide. Which is odd because my step mother says usually Keen's fit small, at least for women's shoes. My toes have just enough room in the front to fit comfortably, but there's too much room everywhere else and my foot clonks around in them when I walk. And they aren't nearly as warm as my old North Face shoes. Sadly they don't make the same ones anymore, so I opted for the Keen version hoping the reviews would help sway me. All in all, WAYY too over-priced for shoes that don't fit well, and don't keep your feet warm in colder weather (as described). I would search elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Size
customer_reviews.text: The fit is perfect because I knew they run a half size big. I have had over 10 pairs of Keens and I always wear a size 10.5 but last year when I bought the brown brixen they were to large, so if you are buying a pair they run at least half size big.
customer_reviews.author: eron feltz

customer_reviews.title: Great concept /Snow shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are warm and very solid. Use a shoe horn to get them on to avoid breaking down the heel! these shoes are heavy and well soled. There are opposite deep grooved threads so going up a snowy elevation, the ball of the foot digs in. When going down an incline, the heel tread digs in. These are slip proof snow shoes. Great for light snows and/or slushy winter stuff. Also keeps the slush out, so appear to be water proof. Had for a couple years with no maintenance required. Don't forget the shoe horn! NE Illinois
customer_reviews.author: 4Warnd

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Expected!
customer_reviews.text: If you need wide shoes, these are for you. Pros: Toe box wide and roomy. Heel fits great. No slippage. Interior soft and warm. Solid construction. Cons: "Tongue" digs into instep at first, but is already breaking in. Will update if material doesn't stretch.
customer_reviews.author: GMAC10

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable Winter shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for my husband and he has worn them once. He says they are very comfortable with room in the toe box for his toes to strech out. He says they are warm and looking forward to wearing them this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Just received it in time for El Niño. Wore them to this event I facilitate and got some great compliments on my shoes and they wanted to know where I got them. Someone wrote that they thought the shoes were ugly, where I actually like them a lot. Yes you do have to get use to the wear around the front of your angles, kind of stiff. The shoes are both comfortable and warm. I'm a faithful Birkenstock wearer and when I do wear something else, it's usually Keen. I wear a size 13 but I got these in a 14 and they fit great. Strong and sturdy shoes, and happy enough to write s review.
customer_reviews.author: algernol boozer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought four pairs in five years. Love them all. Great fit for my wide feet. They are worn everyday for about 12 hours in a harsh work environment so they usually last about a year or less. I bought another pair as a spare in case this model is "improved" ("new and improved" always means poorer quality and improved profit for the manufacturer). May have to stock up on these as it's hard to find a good quality shoe that is comfortable,
customer_reviews.author: Shimon Mor

customer_reviews.title: Too tight on the ankle!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a hard review to write. I LIKE Keen generally, and have owned other pairs in this style but something seems to have changed. The elastic around the ankle is waaaaay too tight and as a result the shoes are almost unwearable? Super painful! I thought it would even out but so far no go.Too bad because they’re pretty great otherwise!
customer_reviews.author: Rez

customer_reviews.title: One Problem !
customer_reviews.text: I would want to keep them because everything are good like ads . However, after I tried on them for one day I didn't feel comfortable with my heels moved up and down while I was walking. So, I did return them. I hope Keen Co. would keep on an eye on this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky-Pacific

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: The sole on this shoe is stiff and as a result as you walk the heel has a tendency to slip up out of the shoe. The fit and finish of this Keen shoe is not the same as the older Keen shoes. I would not pay over $75.00 for this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Love these...BUT
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding shoe in every way ACCEPT workmanship. This is the second pair to blow out stitched seams after about a year and a half of near daily use. It really disappoints me because these shoes are so superior in every other way.
customer_reviews.author: Tony D. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Good fit after break in - warm shoe and great traction
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I would have done differently with this purchase is the color. The black is not as attractive as I expected. I would have gone with the brown. Other than that this was a great purchase and I wear them almost daily.
customer_reviews.author: Demetrios J. Tsillas

customer_reviews.title: High Quality very comfy shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have the same shoes in the brown color. I wanted the black. Great winter shoe. High quality shoe. I love the keen shoes. Soothing comfort for your feet. Excellent foot support. Highly recommend!High quality
customer_reviews.author: Kimber

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed by it's traction review
customer_reviews.text: Really like the quality of the shoe and it's fit. I purchased this shoe based on the traction reviews of no slip including snow, ice and mud. Not slip resistance at all. First time out in the snow,ice and mud , and I fell. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Alex D'Acunto

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes.  Just let them break in a bit.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. Essentially a low cut, slip in boot. Ruggedly built, good traction, water proof. Primarily use them as a winter shoe for working in the yard but they are nice enough to run into town and run errands. They fit a little larger than Keen usually fit me, so I added an additional foot bed under the bed that comes with the shoe and this snugged the fit right up. These shoes rubbed my ankle when I first wore them as other reviews mentioned. A combination of just toughing it out for a few days then adding the extra footbed resulted in no more rubbing and a very comfortable versatile shoe. Would buy them again in a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Apple pie

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe so far no rubbing or blisters
customer_reviews.text: heavy duty out door type shoe. I bought them for walking and work. they fit as expected but i expected them to be a little wider than some other shoes. I was right so i got what i wanted. They are new and so far the cushion is just enough for an hour walk on trails or pavement. They may break in more later so i will update if they do. Good shoe so far no rubbing or blisters. as some have said, the upper can be a little stiff around the ankle. if you wear them a while they soften up and feel better.
customer_reviews.author: jcharms

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, great fit! this is my third pair . Still wearing the first pair. Was afraid they would stop making them and at this price, had to buy.They are comfortable and durable. I like the way they wrap the toes, no wear when kneeling or other motions that require top of toes to contact ground. Slip on makes them great for getting in and out of rv!
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: First Time Buyer Of Keen
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my normal size. Some people said it is too big, others say it is too small. 72% of the commenters state fits as expected, including myself, until I realized I needed to go up 1/2 size after the second day. No fault of Amazon or Keen - Keen recommends on their website that this shoe, the Brixen, should be purchased 1/2 size up from your normal shoe size. I ordered another pair 1/2 size up and it fits "more" perfect. There is something to be said about going to a shoe store and trying on more than one size to get the optimum fit, provided they have them.
customer_reviews.author: Animadverto

customer_reviews.title: great shoe.. use for everything
customer_reviews.text: perfect fit.. says what it does, does what it was designed to do. initially bought them for the rainy winter weather in seatlle, but they fit so well and are super comfy that i turned them in to pretty much my every day shoes now.. one of the best shoes i own..
customer_reviews.author: joesorandom

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great for any outdoor activity in Minnesota,warm,comfortable and has really good traction on snow and ice ...well made really like them and plan on getting another pair
customer_reviews.author: Irish Dave

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: VERY NICE SHOES,LOVE THEM.these shoes did not take long at all to break in,i love these shoes they protect my feet when fishing and standing on rocks,great traction.these are the best shoes I have ever owned.i wore these shoes in freezing weather while fishing and they kept my feet warm and totally dry,they are made to last a long time but when they do wear out I will not hesitate to buy them again.these are a must have for anyone that fishes in cold wet weather.AWSOME shoes.Thank you,,,PAUL LAZZARI
customer_reviews.author: Pvl

customer_reviews.title: BEST brand ever for a man  who wears the same shoe everyday!
customer_reviews.text: Never a complaint to be found on the superior quality and durability of a Keen shoe. If your man wears out every shoe he has in lwss than 6 months, buy Keens.
customer_reviews.author: Joan D. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Hurt my feet
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Keen shoes for a long time. For some reason, these really hurt me on the top of my foot. Since I am a ice skater, it reminded me of lace bite. I really wanted to like them for they seemed well constructed but alas sold them on ebay for I didn't return them in time to meet Amazon's guidelines.
customer_reviews.author: J. Valente

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my 10 year old LL Bean waterproof shoes. They fit perfectly- I always add Superfeet Blue insoles and that worked fine-my feet need that. I have now worn them for the whole winter and they have performed beyond expectations. They look great- seem to be resistant to salt staining and show very little wear. I look forward to wearing them for many more winters...
customer_reviews.author: Mass Gun Owner

customer_reviews.title: Buy them worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Best winter shoes I have owned this is my second pair. They are warm for winter use and very comfortably and Fit as expected with good winter time traction.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to Love them But...
customer_reviews.text: I have had many pairs of Keen's in the past and have always had good luck with fit. Size 11 across the board. I have a slightly wide foot so the larger toe box in Keens worked well for me. When I recieved these and tried them on, I knew right away they wouldn't work form. Really uncomfortable in the toe box and slipped quite a lot in the heal. It's not that they weren't wide enought, they just pused down to heard on my toes. Was looking forward to wearing these through the northeast winter in NY but I guess I'll have to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Osswald

customer_reviews.title: These are NOT non-slip!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a pair of these for my chef position and they are most definitely slipping in the kitchen. Very comfortable, but cannot recommend these for a kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Too tight across top
customer_reviews.text: They are very heavy and extremely tight across the top. While they have expansion material on either side of the top it really dose nothing to ease the tightness. They were killing me after five minutes!
customer_reviews.author: kath

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes! They’re easy to get on and off, they are sturdy, well made, and comfortable! I definitely would buy these again for my husband!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra K. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Don’t forget the shoe horn
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be a well built shoe but buyer beware it is difficult to slip on as the opening for the foot is really small and tight across the top
customer_reviews.author: mas

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get on and feel strange to walk in.
customer_reviews.text: I have other Keen shoes that I love so thought I would try these. Did not like these at all. They are impossible to get on without a shoe horn and I really don't want to have to carry one with me when wearing these. Secondly, once I managed to get them on, when walking my heel tended to slide up and down in the back of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Q Public

customer_reviews.title: You will wish you bought sooner! Get 1/2 size larger than normal
customer_reviews.text: Only shoe I've ever bought a half of size larger than my normal size. Comfortable, GREAT on ice, easy on/off and we'll made. Best shoe purchase ever!
customer_reviews.author: Jess11

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Love these Winter Boots! Perfect to wear to town shopping or anywhere that You have to walk in a little snow or slush. (NICE AND WARM) My normal size is 10 and 1/2, wide, I ordered a size 11, and the fit is great, Plenty of width, and toe room, also nice looking. at first need a shoehorn to get on, so not to break the back down, but gets a lot better as You wear them.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene R. Oomen

customer_reviews.title: They are warm and weatherproof
customer_reviews.text: I live in the Utah mountains and we get a lot of snow. I mostly wear these when I take my dog out. They are warm and have kept my feet dry. Of course, in deep enough snow I have to switch over to boots. My only request is that they add a little "grabber" on the heal to put them on easier. I like them fairly snug so I don't get snow down in them.
customer_reviews.author: S. Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Stitching coming apart
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this model Keen shoe, not only is the size wrong and heavy clod shoe, but they are starting to fall a apart. I have purchased several of the Keen shoes, normally if you where them or not the glue that holds the soles on fails and the soles start coming off, but it took many years. At least the shoes were very comfortable and over all quality was decent for the price, this pair not so, its almost like a cheap pair of payless shoes, they suck.....
customer_reviews.author: DEF088

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable out of the box...
customer_reviews.text: I really like Keen shoes. They are the best fitting for my square foot. I did try an 8, but was too small. the 85. fits right, so 1/2 size up is what I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Couch

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. This is my second pair. I still have my first pair and still wear them, they are 14 years old. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: george

customer_reviews.title: Well made, good fit
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a cheaper pair of Keene's $85-ish and they had lower sides and the rear soon collapsed, so they weren'treally "slip on" any more. These are great.
customer_reviews.author: John Loven

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe for Seattle
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair as my dog ate the first pair. Wonderful shoes that are both waterproof and insulated. I like that they are slipons which are hard to find in this type of shoe/boot, They do run a little large and I went down half a size with the second pair.
customer_reviews.author: wildchinook

customer_reviews.title: Been an owner of these shoes since 2012, they have never let me down
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Keen shoes (of this build) since 2012. In fact, I can still wear the pair from 2012. They’re innately comfortable, I don’t feel like I had to “break” them in whatsoever, and the quality of materials over the past near decade has not been compromised. They’re still fantastic shoes that will handle warehouse floors, hiking, running on pavement, strolls through mud, or casual day to day stuff. I will always recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Mcmindes

customer_reviews.title: Great for wide feet!
customer_reviews.text: Everything was great except for putting the shoes on. I have a tall foot and they are hard to get on. I love the shoes other than that.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Payne

customer_reviews.title: so I got the 12 in these and they are a perfect fit. High quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband, guessing on his size. He wears a 12.5 in Merrell, so I got the 12 in these and they are a perfect fit. High quality, can stand up to any tasks he does on a day-to-day basis and they keep his feet warm. He says they're super comfortable and have become his go-to shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: STURDY SHOE
customer_reviews.text: Solid shoe I like keen products they hold up well. These have a workboot feel instead of a regular slip on or loafer shoe. For me as a rule Keen runs big. I wear a size 12 mens in Merrill and Nike etc. In Keen I fit a 11.5 perfect. I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: BUSHBILL

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes. They look like dress shoes, but have awesome traction. Size is my regular size. Not one size bigger like other reviews have stated.
customer_reviews.author: Joel B

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the comfort and function
customer_reviews.text: Cannot imaging going through another winter on our farm without these slip on water proof shoes. This is my second pair. They are very comfortable. The lining is extremely warm. The fact that they slip on makes them easy to put on on my way out the door, and leave there when I return.
customer_reviews.author: winslow.rce

customer_reviews.title: Hurts my top of my feet
customer_reviews.text: Bought these exact same shoes about 5 years ago and l loved them! Now these one hurt the top of my feet. Perhaps my feet have changed. They fit a bit big so maybe this has also contributed to the pain. Otherwise very good construction. Rugged and will last a long time (hopefully after broken in). Update 1 month later: these shoes do not hurt my feet anymore!! It just needed "break in" period and are completely 100% pain free. I love them so l am changing my review from 3 to 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: I like these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I like these shoes. They are well made, and keep my feet warm and dry in the winter time. They also grip well in the snow and ice, I don't have to worry about slipping. Updated: I still like these shoes only problem is the seams are coming apart with less than a years use, not good!
customer_reviews.author: rgfrnk

customer_reviews.title: Warmest Damn Shoe I ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I have had pins in both ankles and have had back surgery so if I feet get cold it travels up to my back. I love these shoes. Wearing a nice pair of merino wool Hiwasee socks and these shoes feels like I'm walking around in my Teva sandals on a warm summer day. Damn fine shoes! I have not worn any of my other boots or winter footwear since these arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio A. Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because i was having surgery on one of my shoulders. I only wear boots so i would never regularly buy a product like this. The product is perfect! They are easy to slip on and comfortable. I've recommended this product to my friends and family. They are warm in the winter. I was told in other reviews to buy them a size larger or shorter so i went .5 size up and i had to send them back. It was a painless process.
customer_reviews.author: Jared W.

customer_reviews.title: It's amazing that without any aftermarket insoles and for a relatively ...
customer_reviews.text: Keen is the only brand that I can work in a freezer for 12 hours a day and my feet don't hurt. It's amazing that without any aftermarket insoles and for a relatively low price, I can avoid cumbersome work boots and have warm feet all at once.
customer_reviews.author: John Rambo

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for winter flight instructing. They fit as expected and have proved to be warm and very comfortable. I hope they prove to be as durable as they look.
customer_reviews.author: L D Jones

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, warm and bullet-proof
customer_reviews.text: I read a number of comments about the fit, but since becoming a fan of Keen some years back, I've bought many pairs of sandals, hiking shoes, etc... I simply looked at the size on my hiking shoe and ordered the same. They fit beautifully--a little tight to get into, but that is to be expected considering the design of the show. Warm, exceptionally comfortable and water proof (with a bit of silicone spray as insurance...). I'm as pleased with these shows as I've been with any of the other models I've purchased over the years. Great company
customer_reviews.author: Andy P.

customer_reviews.title: One size too small
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 9 shoe for as long as I can remember. I ordered a size 9 and it was way too small. More like a size 8 so I returned and ordered a size 10 which I think will fit perfectly once they have broken in and stretched out a little. Other than that they are great.
customer_reviews.author: BCC

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: My most comfortable shoe! Keen shoes have a wider toe box than a standard D with, which is perfect for me since wide widths can be too wide.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald C. Cottrill

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend these to a friend.
customer_reviews.text: Rather long break in period. Tight across the arch, but now these are excellent shoes for my daily walk. Waterproof, comfortable even walking on snow... large toe box allows lots of wiggle room for my toes.
customer_reviews.author: SteveV

customer_reviews.title: Love these for work Winter or Summer
customer_reviews.text: Love these for work Winter or Summer. Work in and outside, lasted just over a year. reordered same thing. this is my 4th paid of Keens for work and each have lasted just over a year. 5 days a week, 45-50 hour weeks on my feel all day
customer_reviews.author: Mike Raines

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday walking shoe.
customer_reviews.text: This will be my second pair of Keen Brixen walking shoes. I wear them for everyday wear and also for a gentle hike. The only negative is if you are lazy or don’t use a shoe horn you will break the backs of the shoes eventually putting them on....invest in a decent shoehorn!
customer_reviews.author: David Wood

customer_reviews.title: good shoe fits good arrived on time
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoes very comfortable fit just fine I’m a 9 1/2 to 10 depending on the shoe these work great
customer_reviews.author: Montanalivin

product_meta.title: KEEN Men's 1002268 Hiking Boot
product_meta.description: Your new favorite shoe. Combining winter-ready construction with an easy, slip-on style, the brixen low is perfect at home, around town and after a day in the hills. Waterproof nubuck leather and keen. Dry membrane ensure that feet stay dry.
feature_bullets: Waterproof slip-on featuring 200g KEEN.Warm insulation, wool felt lining, and thermal heat shield footbed
